Index-Mo Ibrahim on Governance5/1/2020 12:00:00 AMMinistry of Good GovernanceBIGIRIMANA DieudonneStatistical serviceSDG focal point within the Ministry69265912dieudonneb11@yahoo.frThe Ibrahim Index of Governance in Africa (IIAG) is a tool for measuring and monitoring governance performance in African countries. The Mo Ibrahim Foundation defines governance as access to goods and public services, in the political, social and economic fields to which each citizen can legitimately claim from his state and which every state is required to offer to its fellow citizens. Within the framework of the IIAG, a country's governance performance is measured using four components: Security and Rule of Law, Participation and Human Rights, Sustainable economic development and human development.PercentageIbrahim index of African GovernanceAnnualAnnualWorld BankWorld BankIt is the service of the ministry recognized by the government of BurundiThis indicator is relevantComposite indexAvailable nationallyThe indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international levelTransparency International report on corruption perception / World Bank website
